vialab.SMT

Enum TouchDraw

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<TouchDraw>
      • vialab.SMT.TouchDraw
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<TouchDraw>

    public enum TouchDraw
extends java.lang.Enum<TouchDraw>
    Used to specify what kind of touch visualization and information to display. NONE - None disables all drawing of the touches. It likely should not be used unless an OS-based or the sketch itself is providing the visualisation of the touches. DEBUG - Debug mode will show some debugging info near the touch path, and some extra debug messages on the console. SMOOTH - Smooth mode has a Ripples-like visual representation of touches, and shows whether the touch was assigned or not with an inward or outward ripple effect. TEXTURED - Textured mode uses some nice textures and some fancy opengl. Its kind of an upgrade from SMOOTH.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      CUSTOM
      Custom mode will simple use the user-specified TouchDrawer
      DEBUG
      Debug mode will show some debugging info near the touch path, and some extra debug messages on the console
      NONE
      None disables all drawing of the touches, it likely should not be used unless an OS-based or the sketch itself is providing the visualisation of the touches
      SMOOTH
      Smooth mode has a Ripples-like visual representation of touches, and shows whether the touch was assigned or not with an inward or outward ripple effect
      TEXTURED
      Textured mode uses some nice textures and some fancy opengl.
